result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: No contact with: co defendant JD, co defendant Seth Irwin, co defendant Daymien Perkins. No contact with: JB, SK, SD. No contact with any occupants of 1328 Sunset Rd apartments or the Sunset Rd apartment building and not within 1000 ft of apartment building.

1:39 PM Defendant Daymien L. Perkins appeared by video in custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Rachel Boaz. Attorney Benjamin Lindsay for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Defendant advised of the complaint/penalties thereof. Defendant eligible for PD but will be assigned to another attorney. Court finds probable cause. State recommends $7500.00 cash bail.  Defense waives time limits. Court finds good cause for not scheduling PH. Court orders $7500 cash bail w/conditions.
Status hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
